subject: Log Redfish event for invalid login via RMCPP interface
commitMessage:
Log Redfish event for invalid login via RMCPP interface

This commit adds support for logging RedFish event log while user tries
to attempt login with invalid credentials.
When user trying to login with invalid credentials on RMCP+ session
interface event should be logged in RedFish event log.
This is a requirement for system events auditing purpose.

Tested:
1. Login with wrong credentials on RMCP+ interface.
2. Verified RedFish event logged successfully.

"Members": [
        {
            "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/EventLog/Entries/1622785246",
            "@odata.type": "#LogEntry.v1_4_0.LogEntry",
            "Created": "2021-06-04T05:40:46+00:00",
            "EntryType": "Event",
            "Id": "1622785246",
            "Message": "Invalid username or password attempted on RMCPP.",
            "MessageArgs": [
                "RMCP+"
            ],
            "MessageId": "OpenBMC.0.1.InvalidLoginAttempted",
            "Name": "System Event Log Entry",
            "Severity": "Warning"
        }
    ],
    "Members@odata.count": 1,
    "Name": "System Event Log Entries"
}

3. Verified RedFish validator passed

Signed-off-by: sunitakx <sunitax.kumari@linux.intel.com>
Change-Id: I40b37ff5dd518c52d01b00196e8607c9762a17bf

nit: Redfish
Use same convention everywhere.

Can be rewritten:
Invalid login attempted on IPMI RMCP+ session
Update the message as per commit message comment.

sd_journal_send  is the raw version of event logging. I am not seeing use of sd_journal_send anywhere else. If this repo is not using sd_journal_send then please use phosphor::logging with REDFISH_MESSAGE_ARGS for redfish event logs.

Please log message here also.

You can use the same Redfish message here i.e.) For security purposes, not revealing too much info about why login failed.
All these logs seems repetitive. May be extract this to a small function which can be called at all other places.

This never hit right?
Can 'if' condition check removed ?
you need to log a message without username before this return also.
This return also needs to be covered.
logMessage() itself looks better API name for me.

Add comments section explaining this API and its args.
Please see the previous declarations in this file.

:) I like this.

This should be checked after event log is generated. This should be 3 step in you test.

nit: This can also be made 
static constexpr

I see you added 3rd argument as std:string, but that is not correct when it is generic logMessage(), Its should be of
 - Optional type
 - Should accept multiple entries with dynamic data types.

Since in this code its more of specific log instead of generic log, You can rename function to specific like logInvalidLoginRedfishEvent().
This doesn't make sense as journalctl logs. You can just log like "Invalid login attempted via RCMPP interface"

out of scope of this change. make this as separate patch,

Anyway why "=" is needed? Its doesn't matter in case of equal. minPriv will be same.

"@brief" missing. You can treat this as subject line.

Add body section also, refer previous API RAKP12()

Why you make it as 'INFO' when messageArgs.empty() ?
I guess you intended this also as 'ERR'.

why are you turning a string into a c_str only to have the function construct a new string from it? just pass message.

Here and all calls below to logMessage.
Make this as optional instead of empty string check
This argument also not needed, given that function name is not change to represent single message entry instead of generic.

I believe it is "RMCPP" now.
Please post the latest log.
